content:
That sounds like a great plan! Having a mix of booked accommodations and flexibility in your itinerary will give you the freedom to adjust your plans as you go along.

It's great that you've got a good set of hiking boots and outdoor clothing, as well as a backpack with the essentials. A portable charger is a fantastic idea, especially since you'll be out of cell range for parts of the trip. I'd recommend looking into a rugged and waterproof portable charger that can withstand the elements. Some popular options include:

* Anker PowerCore: A compact and lightweight charger that's perfect for hiking and outdoor activities.
* Goal Zero Torch 250: A waterproof and rugged charger that's designed for outdoor use, with a built-in flashlight and USB ports.
* Mophie Powerstation: A high-capacity charger that's designed for extended trips, with a rugged and water-resistant design.

In addition to a portable charger, you may also want to consider bringing:

* A paper map or a GPS device, in case your phone's GPS doesn't work in certain areas.
* A waterproof phone case or pouch, to protect your phone from water and dust.
* A small daypack or backpack with rain gear, such as a lightweight rain jacket and pants.
* A bear spray or bear bell, depending on the areas you'll be hiking in and the time of year.
* A small first aid kit with any personal medications, as well as supplies for blisters, cuts, and scrapes.

It's also a good idea to check the weather forecast before you head out each day, and to let someone know your itinerary and expected return time.

Overall, it sounds like you're well-prepared for your trip, but it's always a good idea to double-check your gear and plans before you head out. Have a safe and enjoyable trip!
